explains: adj. 无拘束的；放纵的（尤指在社交和性关系方面）
vt. 解放；使摆脱束缚（liberate 的过去式）

sentences.en: The city was liberated by the advancing army.
sentences.cn: 军队向前挺进，解放了那座城市。

sentences.en: Writing poetry liberated her from the routine of everyday life.
sentences.cn: 写诗使她从日常生活的例行公事中解脱出来。

sentences.en: She was determined that she would become a liberated businesswoman.
sentences.cn: 她决定成为一名思想解放的女实业家。
